source_sentence: 其中有佛出世，號毘婆尸如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: There was a Buddha who appeared in the world and was called the Tathāgata Vipaśyin, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer of Husbands, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One.

translation: After the cessation of that image, the king of Vārāṇasī named Mahārāja was wise and virtuous, rightly ruled his country, and didn't wrong his people.

source_sentence: 王主六十小國、八百聚落、五百白象。
translation: The king ruled 60 small states, 800 villages, and 500 white elephants.

source_sentence: 二萬夫人了無有子。
translation: Twenty thousand wives had no children at all.

source_sentence: 王自禱祀諸山、河池、樹木神祇，滿十二年，王第一所重夫人即便有娠；第二夫人亦皆有娠。
translation: After twelve years of praying to the gods of the mountains, rivers, and trees, the king's first wife became pregnant, and his second wife also became pregnant.

source_sentence: 王甚歡喜，手自供養，床臥飲食皆令細軟。
translation: The king was delighted, made offerings with his own hands, and made his bed and food soft and tender.

source_sentence: 至滿十月，太子便生，形體端正，妙色莊嚴，人相具足。
translation: When the tenth month had passed, the crown prince was born, his body was perfectly proportioned, his appearance was exquisite, and he had human features.

source_sentence: 第二夫人亦皆生男。
translation: The second wife also gave birth to a boy.

source_sentence: 王甚歡喜，即召諸臣百官并諸相師婆羅門等，占相吉凶，抱兒示之，便令立字。
translation: The king was delighted, so he summoned his ministers, his hundred officials, and the fortune tellers Brāhmaṇa and others to divine the fortune of his child, take him in his arms, and show him the words to be established.

source_sentence: 相師問言：『此兒生時，有何瑞相？』
translation: The fortune teller asked, 'What auspicious sign will this child have when he's born?'

source_sentence: 答言：『第一太子，其母性行由來弊惡，恚恨妬忌，憍慢自大。
translation: He replied, 'The first prince's mother had a long history of bad behavior, anger, hatred, and jealousy, and she was arrogant and conceited.

source_sentence: 從懷子已來，其性調善，和顏悅色，發言含笑；先意問訊，軟語利益；慈愍眾生，喻如赤子。』
translation: Since he conceived his son, his nature has been good, his countenance has been pleasant, his speech has been smiling, his greetings have been gentle, and his words have been helpful; he has shown kindness to sentient beings and has been likened to a naked child.'

source_sentence: 相師答言：『此是兒之福德使母如此。』
translation: The fortuneteller replied, 'This is the merit of a child that makes his mother like this.'

source_sentence: 即便立字，名曰善友太子。
translation: He then created a name for him, calling him Prince Shangyou.

source_sentence: 第二夫人所生太子者，相師問言：『其子生時，有何瑞相？』
translation: When the second wife gave birth to the prince, the fortuneteller asked, 'What was the son's portentous appearance when he was born?'

source_sentence: 答言：『其母由來性常調善，先意問訊，發言柔軟，可適眾心。
translation: He replied, 'From the beginning, her mother was always good-natured, asked questions beforehand, and spoke softly enough to suit the minds of many people.

source_sentence: 懷妊已來，其性卒暴，發言麤惡，嫉妬恚癡。』
translation: After she became pregnant, her temperament suddenly became violent, her speech was harsh, and she was jealous and rancorous.'

source_sentence: 相師答言：『此是兒之業行使母如是。
translation: The fortuneteller replied, 'This is the son's action exercising his mother like this.

source_sentence: 應當立字，名之惡友太子。』
translation: He should be given a name, 'Bad friend prince.'

source_sentence: 哺乳長大，至年十四。
translation: He nursed and grew up until he was 14 years old.

source_sentence: 善友太子聰明慈仁，好喜布施，父母偏心愛念，視如眼目。
translation: The good-treating prince is intelligent, kind, and fond of generosity, and his parents are partial to him and think of him as their eyes.

source_sentence: 惡友太子其性暴惡，父母憎惡而不憘視；妬嫉於兄，常欲毀害觸事；不順其兄，違逆反戾。
translation: But Prince Nasty Friends was violent and ill-natured, hated by his parents but didn't respect them; he was jealous of his brother and always wanted to harm and touch things; he didn't obey his brother and was disobedient and contrary.

source_sentence: 「善友太子導從前後，作倡伎樂，大眾圍遶。
translation: "The good-companion prince guides them forward and back, performing music and musicians, and the crowd surrounds him.

source_sentence: 出城觀看，見有耕者，墾土出虫，烏隨啄吞。
translation: He left the city to look around and saw a plowboy plowing the soil, and a crow pecked and swallowed it.

source_sentence: 善友太子遙見如是，愍而哀傷，生長深宮，未見此事。
translation: Seeing this from afar, Prince Shangyou was compassionate and sympathetic, and he had grown up deep in his palace, never having seen this before.

source_sentence: 問左右言：『此作何物，共相殘害？』
translation: He asked his attendants, 'What is this thing that's causing mutual harm?'

source_sentence: 左右答言：『太子！
translation: The attendants replied, 'Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 所以有國，依於人民；所以有人民者，依因飲食；所以有飲食者，依因耕田，種植五穀，得存性命。』
translation: That's why there's a country depending on the people; that's why there are people depending on food and drink; and that's why there's food depending on plowing the fields and planting the grains that make it possible to live.'

source_sentence: 太子念言：『苦哉！
translation: The prince thought, 'What suffering!

source_sentence: 苦哉！』
translation: What a pain!'

source_sentence: 小復前行，見諸男女自共織作，來往顧動，疲勞辛苦。
translation: Again, he went ahead and saw women and men weaving together, moving back and forth, and getting tired and tired.

source_sentence: 太子問曰：『此作何物？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What is this?'

source_sentence: 左右答言：『太子！
translation: The attendants replied, 'Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 此諸人等紡織，作諸衣服，以遮慙愧，蔭覆五形。』
translation: These people weave and make clothes to cover their shame and to overshadow their five forms.'

source_sentence: 太子言：『此亦勞苦，非一也。』
translation: The prince said, 'This is also labor and suffering, not the same.'

source_sentence: 轉復前行，見諸人民屠牛駝馬，[利-禾+皮]剝猪羊。
translation: Turning, he went on his way and saw the people slaughtering oxen, camels, horses, and [gain - grain + skin] stripping pigs and sheep.

translation: The crown prince asked, 'Who are these people?'

source_sentence: 左右答言：『此諸人等，屠殺賣肉，以自存活，以供衣食。』
translation: They replied, 'These people are butchering and selling meat to feed and clothe themselves.'

source_sentence: 太子皮毛[目*需]動，而作是言：『怪哉！
translation: The prince's fur [eyes*need] moved, and he said, 'That's strange!

translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 殺者心不忍，強弱相害傷，殺生以養生，積結累劫殃。』
translation: The mind of a killer doesn't tolerate it, and the strong and weak are harmed by each other. Killing life to feed life creates a burden that accumulates over eons.'

source_sentence: 轉復前行，見諸人眾，網鳥餌魚，枉濫無辜，強弱相陵。
translation: Turning again, he went on his way and saw a crowd of people netting birds and baiting fish, wasting away and being innocent, and tormenting both the strong and the weak.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『此是何人？
translation: The prince asked, 'Who are these people?'

translation: What is it called?'

source_sentence: 左右答言：『太子！

translation: They net birds and catch fish.

translation: Such things are done to provide food and clothing.'

translation: After hearing these words, the prince's eyes were filled with tears of pity, 'Worldly beings create bad roots.

source_sentence: 眾苦不息，憂愁不悅。』
translation: Their suffering doesn't stop, and they're sad and unhappy.'

source_sentence: 即迴車還宮。
translation: He then returned to the palace in his chariot.

source_sentence: 「王問太子：『出還何故愁憂如此？』
translation: "The king then asked the prince, 'Why are you so sad and troubled when you leave and return?'

source_sentence: 太子具以上事向父王說。
translation: The prince told his father everything that had happened up there.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，語太子言：『上來諸事未常不有，何足愁耶？』
translation: When the king heard this, he said to the prince, 'Why should there be any cause for concern when the things that happened up there haven't always happened?'

source_sentence: 太子言：『今欲從王求索一願，王見聽不？』
translation: The prince said, 'Now, I'd like to ask the king for one wish; will the king grant it?'

source_sentence: 王言：『吾有汝一子，甚愛念之，不逆汝意。』
translation: The king said, 'I have one son of yours whom I greatly desire and won't disobey you.'

source_sentence: 太子言：『願欲得父王一切庫藏，所有財寶飲食，用施一切。』
translation: The prince said, 'I wish to gain access to all of my father's treasury and to use all the wealth, food, and drink that I have to give.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨汝所願，不逆子意。』
translation: The king said, 'Do as you wish, and don't oppose your son's wishes.'

translation: "Prince Shangyou then opened the king's treasury with five hundred large elephants loaded with treasures and went out beyond the four gates of the city and told the land, 'If anyone wants to be clothed and fed, feel free to take it for yourself and leave.'

source_sentence: 善友太子名聲遠聞八方，一切雲集。
translation: The reputation of Prince Shangyou was heard far and wide, and all the people gathered there.

translation: Before long, three parts of it were used as one.

translation: The king should consider it.'

translation: The king said, 'This is the crown prince, so I dare not disobey him.'

translation: The minister guarding the treasury was absent on account of his actions, and he pursued him with care, but he didn't meet him.

source_sentence: 善友太子言：『此小人者，何敢違逆我意？
translation: Prince Shangyou said, 'How would this little man dare to disobey my wishes?'

source_sentence: 當是父王教耳。
translation: This should be the father's teaching.

source_sentence: 夫孝子者，不應傾竭父母庫藏。
translation: A filial son shouldn't empty his father's and mother's treasury.

source_sentence: 我今應當自求財寶，給足眾生。
translation: Now, I should seek my own wealth and treasure and provide for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我若不能給足一切眾生衣被飲食，稱意與者，云何名為大王太子？』
translation: If I can't adequately clothe and feed all sentient beings and give them what they desire, then how can I be called the great king-prince?'

source_sentence: 即集諸臣百官共論議言：『夫求財利，何業最勝？』
translation: He then gathered his ministers and hundred officials together to discuss the matter, saying, 'What is the best activity for seeking wealth and profit?'

source_sentence: 中有第一大臣言：『世間求利，莫先耕田者，種一萬倍。』
translation: The first of these ministers said, 'There's no better way to seek profit in the world than to cultivate a field and plant it 10,000 times over.'

source_sentence: 復有一大臣言：『世間求利，莫先畜養眾生，放牧滋息，其利最大。』
translation: Another minister said, 'There's no better way to seek profit in the world than to stock up on sentient beings and graze them for nourishment, which will be most profitable.'

source_sentence: 復有一大臣言：『世間求利，莫先入海採取妙寶。
translation: Another minister said, 'There's no better way to get profit in the world than to go into the ocean and collect marvelous treasures.

source_sentence: 若得摩尼寶珠者，便能稱意給足一切眾生。』
translation: If he obtains a maṇi-jewel, then he'll be able to fulfill his wish for all sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 善友太子言：『唯此為快耳。』
translation: The good friend, the prince, said, 'Only this would be pleasant.'

source_sentence: 即入宮中，上白父王：『子今欲入大海，採取妙寶。』
translation: He went into the palace and told his father, 'Now, my son wants to go into the ocean and collect that marvelous treasure.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，譬如人噎，亦不得咽，又不得吐，語太子言：『國是汝有，庫藏珍寶隨意取用，何為方復自入大海？

source_sentence: 汝為吾子，生長深宮，臥則幃帳，食則恣口。
translation: You were my son, growing up in a deep palace, lying in an ornamented tent and eating as you pleased.

source_sentence: 今者遠涉塗路，飢渴寒暑，誰得知者？
translation: Now, you've traveled far and wide, and you're hungry and thirsty in the cold and heat; who would know?

source_sentence: 又復大海之中，眾難非一，或有惡鬼毒龍；湍浪猛風，洄波涌澓；水泡之山，摩竭大魚。
translation: "Furthermore, in the middle of the ocean, there are many difficulties that aren't one, some are bad spirits and poisonous dragons, turbulent waves and fierce winds, migrating waves and turbulent seas, and bubbling mountains of water and large fish.

translation: Now, why do you want to enter the ocean?

translation: Even then, Prince Shangyou threw himself to the ground with five bodies, spread his hands and feet four times, and said, 'If my parents don't listen to me as I enter the ocean, I will abandon my life here and never arise.'

source_sentence: 「爾時大王及諸夫人見是事已，目不暫捨，即前勸諫太子：『汝可起飲食。』
translation: "Seeing this, the king and the ladies didn't look away for a moment, but they went forward to advise the prince, 'You may get up and eat.'

translation: The king and his wife were distressed and distressed, weeping from side to side, grieving and distressed, and falling to the ground in distress.

source_sentence: 如是乃至一日不飲不食，二日三日至到六日。
translation: It was thus for one day that they didn't drink or eat, and for two, three, or six days.

source_sentence: 父母憂愁，畏其不濟。
translation: Their parents were distressed and afraid that they wouldn't be helped.

translation: Immediately before the seventh day, they cry, embrace their hands and feet, and are kindly told, 'You can start eating and drinking.'

translation: This body, which is pretend to be food, depends on food and drink to survive.

translation: If you don't eat, your life won't be saved.'

translation: The prince said, 'If your parents don't approve, you'll surely perish here and never arise.'

source_sentence: 「爾時第一夫人便白王言：『如子心意難可傾動，不可違戾，何忍當見此子捨命於此？
translation: "The First Lady then said to the king, 'If the son's mind is difficult to disregard and cannot be contradicted, how could you bear to see him abandon his life here?'

source_sentence: 願大王垂慈，聽入大海，故當萬有一冀。
translation: May the great king have mercy and listen to him as he enters the ocean, so there will be one hope in a million.

source_sentence: 今不聽者，必喪於此。』
translation: If I don't listen now, I will surely die here.'

translation: The king couldn't bear to refuse, so he gave his permission.

source_sentence: 「爾時，善友太子即起歡喜，頭面禮父王足。
translation: "At that point, Prince Shangyou rejoiced and bowed his head and face at his father's feet.

source_sentence: 左右夫人及諸婇女百千萬人，互相問言：『善友太子今者，為死活耶？』
translation: The ladies and the tens of millions of women on his right and left asked each other, 'Is Prince Shangyou dead or alive now?'

source_sentence: 答言：『太子今者已起，歡喜飲食。』
translation: He answered, 'The prince has risen and is rejoicing in his food.'

source_sentence: 王問太子：『汝慇懃欲入大海，何所作為？』
translation: The king asked the prince, 'What are you doing, desirous of entering the ocean?'

source_sentence: 答言：『大王！
translation: He replied, 'Great king!

translation: Do you see it yet?'

source_sentence: 即以導師，金沙覆上，埋著地中，右遶七匝，頂禮而去。
translation: He then covered the ground with a guide, covered it with gold sand, circled it to the right seven times, paid homage, and departed.

translation: At that point, Prince Shangyou then entered the samādhi of compassion, and with the power of that samādhi, he rose up, stepped onto a lotus leaf, and left - without harming the vipers, because of the power of his compassionate mind - and went straight to where the dragon king was staying.

translation: After their parents heard those words, they raised their voices and wept profusely, fell to the ground in despair, and sprinkled their faces with cold water; after a long time, they came to rest.

translation: The prince, a good friend, said, 'May I release my bad friend so that I can see him?'

source_sentence: 如是言至三，王不忍拒，便開獄門。
translation: He said this up to three times, and the king couldn't bear to refuse, so he opened the prison door.

source_sentence: 「爾時惡友手脚杻械頸項枷鏁，往見善友。
translation: "At that point, his bad friend's hands and feet were bound, and he was bound by a fetter around his neck, so he went to see his good friend.

source_sentence: 兄見如是，上白父母：『為弟脫於枷鏁。』
translation: Seeing this, the elder brother went up to his parents and said, 'Take off the fetters for my younger brother.'

source_sentence: 脫枷鏁已，即前抱持，善言誘喻，軟語問訊：『汝極勞苦耶？
translation: After he took off the fetters, he immediately went to embrace him, spoke kindly and enticingly, and asked him softly, 'Are you suffering terribly?'

source_sentence: 汝持我寶珠，今在何處？』
translation: Where are the precious pearls you have with you now?'

source_sentence: 如是至三，而方報言：『在彼土中。』
translation: He did so up to the third time, and then he replied, 'It's in that land.'

source_sentence: 善友太子還得寶珠，往父母前，跪燒妙香，即呪誓言：『此寶珠是如意寶者，令我父母兩目明淨如故。』
translation: When he got back the precious pearl, Prince Shangyou went to his parents, knelt down, burned a wonderful incense, and vowed, 'This precious pearl is a wish-granting jewel that will make my parents' eyesight as clear as before.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，尋時平復。
translation: After making this vow, he then recovered.

source_sentence: 父母得見其子，歡喜踊躍，慶幸無量。
translation: When their parents saw their son, they rejoiced and jumped for joy, and their happiness was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 「爾時善友太子於月十五日朝，淨自澡浴，著鮮淨衣，燒妙寶香。
translation: "On the fifteenth day of the moon, Prince Shangyou washed himself, put on fresh and pure clothing, and burned a wonderful precious incense.

source_sentence: 於高樓觀上，手捉香爐，頭面頂禮摩尼寶珠，立誓願言：『我為閻浮提一切眾生故，忍太辛苦，求是寶珠。』
translation: He was perched on a high building observing the incense burner in his hand, saluted the precious maṇi pearl with his head, and vowed, 'For the sake of all the sentient beings in Jambudvīpa, I will endure too much hardship to seek this precious pearl.'

source_sentence: 爾時東方有大風起，吹去雲霧，虛空之中皎然明淨，并閻浮提所有糞穢、大小便利、灰土、草莾，涼風動已，皆令清淨。
translation: At the time, a great wind rose in the east, blowing away the clouds and mist, and the sky was bright and clear, and all the dung, large and small conveniences, ashes, dirt, and rogues in Jambudvīpa were made clean by the cool breeze that moved them.

source_sentence: 以珠威德，於閻浮提遍雨成熟自然粳米，香甘軟細，色味具足，溝渠盈滿，積至于膝；次雨名衣、上服、珠環、釵釧；次雨金銀七寶，眾妙伎樂。
translation: Because of the pearl's authoritative power, Jambudvīpa is flooded with naturally ripened millet that's sweet and tender, with a variety of flavors and gutters that fill to their knees; it then rains down famous robes, fine clothing, jewelry rings, and bracelets; it then rains down gold, silver, seven treasures, and a multitude of wonderful tricks and music.

source_sentence: 舉要言之，一切眾生所須樂具，皆悉充足。
translation: To summarize, these are all the necessities and pleasures of all sentient beings, and they're all plentiful.

source_sentence: 菩薩修大慈悲，行檀波羅蜜，給足眾生一切樂具，其事如是。」
translation: It's thus when a bodhisattva cultivates great compassion and practices the perfection of giving sentient beings all the necessities for their happiness."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時波羅奈大王者，今現我父悅頭檀是；爾時母者，今現我母摩耶夫人是；爾時惡友太子者，今提婆達多是；爾時善友太子者，今我身是。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "At the time, the great king Vārāṇasī was my father, and now my mother, Lady Māyā, is my mother; at the time, the prince was a bad friend, and now Devadatta is; and at the time, the prince was a good friend, and now I am.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 提婆達多過去世時，常懷惡心，毀害於我。
translation: When Devadatta passed away, he always had bad intentions and maligned me.

source_sentence: 而我以忍辱力，常念施恩，因乃得濟，況今成佛？」
translation: With the power of patience and constant mindfulness of the kindness I've given, I was able to be saved, so why would I become a buddha now?"

source_sentence: 佛說此法時，無量百千人得須陀洹果乃至阿羅漢果；復有無量百千人皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心；乃至無量百千眾生皆發聲聞辟支佛心。
translation: When the Buddha taught this teaching, measureless hundreds of thousands of people attained the fruit of stream entry and even the fruit of the arhat; measureless hundreds of thousands of people also aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment; and measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings aroused the minds of śrāvakas and solitary buddhas.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「當何名此經？
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "What shall we call this sūtra?

source_sentence: 云何奉持？」
translation: How do you uphold it?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「此經名『佛報恩方便給足一切眾生』。」
translation: The Buddha said, "This sūtra is called 'The Buddha's repayment of kindness is skillfully sufficient for all sentient beings.'"

source_sentence: 眾會聞經，歡喜作禮而去。
translation: The assembly heard the sūtra, rejoiced, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 復次，提婆達多雖復隨佛出家，嫉妬情深，規望利養。
translation: Furthermore, although he had left home again after the Buddha, Devadatta was deeply jealous and had expectations for profit and benefit.

source_sentence: 雖復能多讀誦六萬香象經，而不能免阿鼻地獄罪。
translation: Even though he could recite the 60,000 Scents of Elephants sūtra more often, he couldn't avoid the sin of avīci hell.

source_sentence: 是人與阿闍世王共為親善，心相愛念，信用其言。
translation: That person and Ajātaśatru were close friends, had fond thoughts, and trusted his words.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多報阿闍世王言：「汝可作新王，我亦欲作新佛。」
translation: Devadatta then said to King Ajātaśatru, "You could be a new king, and I want to be a new Buddha."

source_sentence: 阿闍世報言：「此事不然。
translation: The Ajātaśatru replied, "That's not true.

source_sentence: 父王存在。」
translation: The father king exists."

source_sentence: 提婆達多言：「汝應除之；我亦欲滅佛。
translation: Devadatta said, "You should get rid of him, and I want to annihilate the Buddha.

source_sentence: 然後新王、新佛教化眾生，不亦快乎？」
translation: Wouldn't it be nice if a new king and a new Buddha would then teach sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 時阿闍世即隨其言，斷父王命，王波羅奈國。
translation: The Ajātaśatru then followed his words, cut off his father's life, and ruled the kingdom of Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 提婆達多報阿闍世王言：「我欲毀害如來。」
translation: Devadatta told the Ajātaśatru, "I want to harm the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 阿闍世言：「如來有大神力，豫知人之所念，汝今云何乃能加害？
translation: The Ajātaśatru said, "The Tathāgata has great supernormal powers and can readily understand what people think, so how could you do that now?

source_sentence: 如來兼有諸大弟子——舍利弗、大目揵連、欽婆羅、阿[少/兔]樓駄等。」
translation: The Tathāgata also has great disciples-Shariputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Kimbara, A[lesser/rabbit] and others."

source_sentence: 提婆達多報阿闍世言：「王今助我。」
translation: Devadatta said to the Ajātaśatru, "Now, the king has helped me."

source_sentence: 阿闍世言：「何所作為？」
translation: The Ajātaśatru said, "What did you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「大王！
translation: He replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 當立制限，不聽施諸比丘衣被飲食。」
translation: A limit will be set, so you won't be allowed to give monks clothing, food, or drink."

source_sentence: 阿闍世王遍宣令言：「若有施諸比丘衣被飲食者，當斷汝手足。」
translation: The king of Ajātaśatru universally decreed, "If you give monks clothing, food, and drink, your hands and feet will be cut off."

source_sentence: 是諸大弟子一切大眾共佛住耆闍崛山，次第乞食，了不能得，一日乃至七日。
translation: The whole assembly of these great disciples stayed with the Buddha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and begged for food in order, unable to obtain it for a day or seven days.

source_sentence: 舍利弗諸大弟子等皆以神力，而往諸方求衣乞食。
translation: With miraculous powers, all of Śāriputra's great disciples went to various places to solicit clothing and food.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多白阿闍世王言：「佛諸大弟子等，今皆不在。
translation: Devadatta then said to King Ajātaśatru, "The Buddha's great disciples are all gone now.

source_sentence: 如來單獨一身。
translation: The Tathāgata is all alone.

source_sentence: 王可遣信，往請如來。
translation: The king can send someone faithful to invite the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 若入宮城，即當以酒飲五百大惡黑象，極令奔醉。
translation: If he enters the palace, he'll drink wine to 500 huge, evil black elephants and make them very drunk.

source_sentence: 佛若受請來入城者，當放大醉象，而踏殺之。」
translation: If the Buddha accepts the invitation to enter the city, he'll make the elephants drunk and trample them to death."

source_sentence: 時阿闍世王遣使往請如來。
translation: King Ajātaśatru then sent an envoy to invite the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 佛與五百阿羅漢即受王請，前入王舍城。
translation: The Buddha and 500 arhats then accepted the king's invitation and went into Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時阿闍世王即放五百醉象，奔逸搪揬，樹木摧折，牆壁崩倒，哮嚇大吼，向於如來。
translation: It was then that the Ajātaśatru king released five hundred drunken elephants that ran wild, battered trees and crumbled down walls, and roared and shouted at the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時五百阿羅漢皆大恐怖，踊在空中，徘徊佛上。
translation: The five hundred arhats were terrified and jumped into the air, hovering above the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難圍遶如來，恐怖不能得去。
translation: At the time, Ānanda surrounded the Tathāgata, terrified, and unable to leave.

source_sentence: 爾時如來以慈悲力，即舉右手，於五指頭出五師子，開口哮吼，五百醉象恐怖躃地。
translation: Then, with the power of compassion, the Tathāgata raised his right hand, put five lions on his five fingers, and opened his mouth to roar, causing the five hundred drunken elephants to fall to the ground in terror.

source_sentence: 爾時如來，大眾圍遶，前入王宮。
translation: The Tathāgata was then surrounded by the crowd and went forward into the king's palace.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世王即出奉迎，請佛令坐；佛即坐已，求哀懺悔，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The king of Ajātaśatru then went out to greet him, asked the Buddha to make him sit down, and after he sat down, he begged for pity and repentance and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 非是我過，提婆達多耳。」
translation: It's not my fault, Devadatta."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我亦知之。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "I know it, too.

source_sentence: 提婆達多常欲毀害，非適今也。
translation: Devadatta always wanted to harm, not just now.

source_sentence: 過去世時亦常欲毀害我。
translation: In times past, he also always wanted to harm me.

source_sentence: 我以慈悲力，乃能得濟。」
translation: It was only through the power of my compassion that I was able to save him."

source_sentence: 爾時阿闍世王叉手，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: With his palms together, King Ajātaśatru then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多過去世時毀害如來，其事云何？」
translation: What happened when Devadatta disparaged the Tathāgata in a past life?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「諦聽！
translation: The Buddha said, "Listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去不可計劫，有大國王憘食鴈肉，使一獵師常網捕鴈。
translation: It was an incalculable time in the distant past when a great king ate meat from a lot and had a hunter always catching wild animals in his net.

source_sentence: 時有五百群鴈從北方來，飛空南過，中有鴈王墮落網中。
translation: Then, a group of 500 seals came from the north and flew south, and one of them, the king of the seals, fell into the net.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師心大歡喜，即出草菴，欲取殺之。
translation: The hunter was delighted, so he went out of his hayloft and tried to kill him.

source_sentence: 時有一鴈，悲鳴吐血，徘徊不去。
translation: At the time, there was a king goose that cried out in pity and spit blood, but it wandered off.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師彎弓欲射，不避弓矢，目不暫捨，即鼓兩翅，來投鴈王。
translation: The hunter then bent his bow in order to shoot it, but he didn't avoid the bow and didn't look away for a moment as he puffed out his two wings and threw them at the king.

source_sentence: 五百群鴈，徘徊虛空，亦復不去。
translation: Five hundred of them wandered into the sky, but they didn't leave either.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師見此一鴈，悲鳴吐血，顧戀如是。
translation: Seeing this one animal, the hunter cried out in pity and spit blood, and he looked after it like this.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師作是念言：『鳥獸尚能共相戀慕，不惜身命，其事如是。
translation: The hunter then had this thought, 'Such is the way a bird or animal can adore one another and not spare its own life.

source_sentence: 我今當以何心，而殺是鴈王？』
translation: What intention would I have had to kill this king of the birds now?'

source_sentence: 尋時開網，放使令去。
translation: He then opened the net and released the messenger to leave.

source_sentence: 爾時一鴈悲鳴歡喜，鼓翅隨逐，五百群鴈，前後圍遶，飛空而去。
translation: At that point, a wild animal cries out in joy and pity, bulges its wings, and follows, and five hundred animals fly off in the air, surrounded by them from front to back.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師即白大王：『網得一鴈王，應送王厨，供辦飲食。
translation: The hunter then said to the king, 'We found a king of seals in the net that we should send to the king's kitchen to serve food.'

source_sentence: 而見一鴈，悲鳴吐血，不避弓矢，徘徊不去。
translation: Instead, he saw a wild animal that cried out in pity and spat blood, didn't avoid a bow and arrow, and wandered off.

source_sentence: 時念此鴈，尋放鴈王，五百隨從，前後圍遶，飛空而去。』
translation: Then, mindful of this particular animal, he sought out the king of the animals and released him, surrounded by 500 followers, and flew off into the air.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王聞是語已，心意慘然，尋發慈心：『鳥獸共相愛念，護惜他命，其事如是。』
translation: After hearing those words, the king's thoughts were distressed, and he then had a compassionate thought, 'Such is the way birds and animals love and cherish each other and protect their lives.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王即斷鴈肉，誓不復捕。
translation: The king then cut off their flesh and vowed not to catch them again.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: "Great king!

source_sentence: 當知爾時王者，今大王身是；爾時獵師者，今提婆達多是；爾時一鴈悲鳴吐血者，今阿難是；爾時五百群鴈者，今五百阿羅漢是；爾時鴈王者，今我身是。
translation: You should know that at the time, the king was the present-day Maharaja; at the time, the hunter was the present-day Devadatta; at the time, the one who cried out in lamentation and spat blood was the present-day Ānanda; at the time, the five hundred groupings of wild animals were the present-day five hundred arhats; and at the time, the king of the animals was the present-day me.

source_sentence: 「爾時阿難心生顧戀，如本不異；爾時五百阿羅漢飛騰虛空，亦如本不異；爾時提婆達多常欲毀害於我，我以慈悲力故，因乃得濟。」
translation: "At the time, Ānanda's mind became attached to him as before; at the time, the five hundred arhats soared into the sky, also as before; and at the time, Devadatta always wanted to harm me, but I was able to save him because of the power of my compassion."

source_sentence: 說是法時，無量百千人或得初果乃至四果，或發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，乃至聲聞、辟支佛心。
translation: When this teaching was given, measureless hundreds of thousands of people sometimes attained the first realization up to the fourth realization, or they arouse the mind of unsurpassed, corrected bodhi, or even the minds of śrāvakas and solitary buddhas.

source_sentence: 「復次，提婆達多惡心不息，而作是念：『我今應當長養十指爪甲，極令長利，於爪甲下塗以毒藥。
translation: "Furthermore, Devadatta's evil thoughts didn't subside, and he thought, 'Now, I will grow fingernails on my ten fingers, making them very sharp and coating the underside of them with poison.

source_sentence: 往如來所，頭面接足禮時，我當以十指甲抓足趺上，毒藥入體，其必喪命。』
translation: When I go to the Tathāgata and bow with my head and feet, I will grab my feet and legs with my ten fingernails, and poison will enter my body; it will surely kill me.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，如所思惟，往如來所，頭面作禮，以手接足。
translation: After he thought this, he thus considered going to the Tathāgata, saluting him with his head and face, and picking up his feet with his hands.

source_sentence: 爾時毒藥變成甘露，於如來身竟無所為。
translation: The poison then became nectar, and there was nothing left in the Tathāgata's body that he didn't do.

source_sentence: 「復次，提婆達多既不果願，復作是念：『如來今者坐耆闍崛山下。
translation: "Furthermore, since he hadn't fulfilled his vow, Devadatta again thought, 'Now, the Tathāgata is sitting at the bottom of Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 我今應當上山，頭頂上排山上石下，斷其命根。』
translation: Now, I should go up on that mountain, line up the rocks on the mountain from the top of my head, and cut off his life's root.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，上山排石，傷佛足指。
translation: After that thought, he went up on the mountain and lined up the rocks, cutting the Buddha's toes.

source_sentence: 我慈悲心，怨親同等。
translation: My compassionate attitude is equal to that of enemies and relatives.

source_sentence: 「復次，提婆達多，過去久遠不可計劫，爾時有佛，出興于世，號曰應現如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: "Furthermore, Devadatta, there was a Buddha who appeared in the world at a time in the distant past that goes back incalculable eons and was called the Arhat Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer of Beings, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One.

source_sentence: 佛滅度後，於像法中，有一坐禪比丘，獨住林中。
translation: After the Buddha's death, there was a meditating monk who lived alone in a forest among the images and teachings.

source_sentence: 爾時比丘甞患蟣虱，即便共虱而作約言：『我若坐禪，汝宜默然隱身寂住。』
translation: At the time, the monk was suffering from a tick, so he made a promise with the tick, saying, 'If I were to meditate, you should stay silent and still.'

source_sentence: 其虱如法。
translation: The louse did as instructed.

source_sentence: 於後一時，有一土蚤來至虱邊，問言：『汝云何身體肌肉肥盛？』
translation: At some point later, a flea of the soil came to the louse and asked, 'Why do you have muscular body fat?'

source_sentence: 虱言：『我所依主人常修禪定，教我飲食時節。
translation: The louse says, 'My master always cultivates meditation and teaches me the right times to eat and drink.

source_sentence: 我如法飲食故，所以身體鮮肥。』
translation: As a result of eating according to the rules, I've gained weight.'

source_sentence: 蚤言：『我亦欲修習其法。』
translation: The flea said, 'I also want to train in that teaching.'

source_sentence: 虱言：『能爾隨意。』
translation: The louse said, 'So do as you like.'

source_sentence: 爾時比丘尋便坐禪。
translation: The monk then found a way to sit in meditation.

source_sentence: 爾時土蚤聞血肉香，即便食噉。
translation: Smelling the scent of flesh and blood, the flea then proceeded to eat and devour it.

source_sentence: 「爾時比丘心生苦惱，即便脫衣，以火燒之。」
translation: "Distressed, the monk then took off his clothes and burned them in the fire."

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時坐禪比丘者，今迦葉佛是；爾時土蚤者，今提婆達多是；爾時虱者，今我身是。
translation: The Buddha said, "The monk who was meditating at the time was the present-day Kāśyapa Buddha, the earth flea was the present-day Devadatta, and the louse was the present-day me.

source_sentence: 提婆達多為利養故，毀害於我。
translation: Devadatta disparaged me for the sake of nurturing.

source_sentence: 乃至今日成佛，亦為利養，出佛身血，生入地獄。
